content.raw:
The fix is good and I think this behavior is more ‘correct’. But I’m worried about the side effect of incurring extra gpu memory usage. Currently for the subt project we have worlds that consist of a large number of models and many of them use the same set of high resolution textures. With this change, the gpu RAM usage increased from 4GB to 7GB so it going to be problematic for computers with lower end graphics cards.

One possible workaround I can think of is to internally store hashes of textures so that we can uniquely identify them. That’s a bit of extra added logic though. What do you think?
